title: [UI Bug] Navigation crash - Cannot read property navigate of undefined
description:
## Error
Uncaught Error: Cannot read property 'navigate' of undefined

## Severity
SYSTEMIC - affects nearly all navigation actions. Occurs repeatedly (Log 4 of 4, Log 5 of 5 observed).

## Call Stack (partial)
- loadModuleImplementation (require.js:238)
- _performTransitionSideEffects (Pressability.js:758)
- _receiveSignal (Pressability.js:697)
- responderEventHandlers.onResponderRelease

## Likely Cause
Something is calling navigate() when nav-ref is undefined. Possibilities:
1. A useEffect or subscription callback tries to navigate before NavigationContainer mounts
2. Hot reload invalidates the nav-ref but components still hold stale reference
3. Error boundary or toast component tries to navigate on error

## Reproduction
Almost any navigation action triggers this:
- Navigate to SessionList with empty params
- Navigate to CommandExecution
- General navigation flow

## Impact
Blocks normal app usage - error overlay appears frequently

title: [UI Bug] Unsafe navigation calls - missing nil checks
description:
## Problem
Multiple views call .navigate on the navigation prop without checking if it exists.

## Affected Files
- directory_list.cljs: settings-button uses (.navigate navigation ...) without guard
- session_list.cljs: commands-button and render-item use (.navigate navigation ...) without guard  
- command_menu.cljs: command on-press handlers use (.navigate navigation ...) without guard

## Root Cause
The navigation prop can be undefined during:
- Hot reload (stale references)
- Component mounting race conditions
- Module loading

## Fix
Wrap all .navigate calls:
```clojure
(when navigation
  (.navigate navigation "ScreenName" params))
```

Or use the safe navigate! function from voice-code.views.core:
```clojure
(voice-code.views.core/navigate! "ScreenName" params)
```

## Related
This is the root cause of VCMOB-1i4 (navigation crash)

title: [UI Bug] SessionList shows 'No Sessions' despite data being available in subscription
description:
## Description
SessionList and Conversation views show empty state despite subscriptions containing data.

## Affected Views
1. **SessionList** - Shows 'No Sessions' when subscription has 20 sessions
2. **Conversation** - Shows 'Start a Conversation' when subscription has 54 messages

## Root Cause
Likely Reagent reactivity issue with `r/reactify-component` wrapper used for React Navigation screens. The reactive context may not be properly established when components are created through React Navigation.

## Additional Finding
Messages in the subscription have nil `:text` and `:role` fields - possible data parsing issue from WebSocket message handling.

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Authenticate via REPL
2. Navigate to SessionList or Conversation
3. Observe empty state despite subscription returning data

## Technical Analysis
```clojure
;; Subscription returns correct data:
@(rf/subscribe [:sessions/for-directory "/path"]) ;; => 20 sessions
@(rf/subscribe [:messages/for-session id]) ;; => 54 messages

;; But components check (empty? sessions) or (empty? messages) => true
```

## Impact
P1 - Core functionality broken. Users cannot see sessions or messages.

title: [UI Bug] DirectoryList session count not displayed - clj->js key conversion issue
description:
## Steps to Reproduce
1. Open the app
2. View the Projects (DirectoryList) screen
3. Observe each directory item shows 'sessions' without a number

## Expected Behavior
Each directory item should show the session count, e.g., '3 sessions' or '1 session'

## Actual Behavior
Each directory item just shows 'sessions' with no count

## Screenshot
/tmp/test-screenshot-1.png

## Root Cause
In directory_list.cljs, the render-item function uses:
```clojure
:session-count (.-sessionCount item)
```

But `clj->js` converts `{:session-count 5}` to JavaScript object with key `"session-count"` (preserves kebab-case as string), NOT `sessionCount`.

## Fix
Change the property access from:
```clojure
:session-count (.-sessionCount item)
:last-modified (.-lastModified item)
```
to:
```clojure
:session-count (aget item "session-count")
:last-modified (aget item "last-modified")
```

Or use `:keywordize-keys` option when converting.

## Additional Context
- File: frontend/src/voice_code/views/directory_list.cljs
- Function: directory-list-view, render-item callback
- Same issue likely affects last-modified display

title: [UI Bug] Screen frozen on CommandExecution - navigation/auth state changes don't trigger re-render
description:
## Description
The UI becomes completely frozen on the CommandExecution screen and does not respond to any navigation or authentication state changes.

## Steps to Reproduce
1. App is showing CommandExecution screen (from previous command)
2. Authenticate via REPL
3. Attempt to navigate to any screen via `navigate!` or `.reset`
4. Navigation state changes (verified via `.getState`) but UI doesn't update

## Observed Behavior
- Navigation state shows `{:index 2, :routes [DirectoryList, Settings, DirectoryList]}`
- UI continues to show CommandExecution screen (not in routes array!)
- Setting `authenticated? false` doesn't show auth-view
- `.reset` with new routes doesn't update display

## Expected Behavior
- Navigation should update displayed screen
- Auth state change should switch between auth-view and NavigationContainer

## Technical Details
- nav-ref.getState() returns correct state
- re-frame subscriptions return correct values
- React component tree not re-rendering
- re-frame warning visible: "no :event handler registered for: (...)"

## Impact
P0 - App unusable when this state occurs. Requires app restart to recover.
